{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [ { "sha": "a02693788837e7306e2a90c3a46261e1943b6ccc", "filename": "docs/external-id/direct-federation.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 1, "changes": 2, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/caa8b60d3aff0c2587dcab359041a7e045514f8b/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fdirect-federation.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/caa8b60d3aff0c2587dcab359041a7e045514f8b/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fdirect-federation.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fdirect-federation.md?ref=caa8b60d3aff0c2587dcab359041a7e045514f8b", "patch": "@@ -61,7 +61,7 @@ Refer to the following tables for the required values.\n \n |Attribute |Value for a workforce tenant |Value for an external tenant |\n |-------------------------|-----------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------|\n-|AssertionConsumerService |`https://login.microsoftonline.com/login.srf` |`https://.ciamlogin.com/login.srf`|\n+|AssertionConsumerService |`https://login.microsoftonline.com/login.srf` |`https://.ciamlogin.com/login.srf` Add `https://.ciamlogin.com/login.srf` as the callback/ACS URL on the external IdP if required by that provider.|\n |Audience |`https://login.microsoftonline.com//` (Recommended) Replace `` with the tenant ID of the Microsoft Entra tenant you're setting up federation with.

In the SAML request sent by Microsoft Entra ID for external federations, the Issuer URL is a tenanted endpoint (for example, `https://login.microsoftonline.com//`). For any new federations, we recommend that all our partners set the audience of the SAML or WS-Fed based IdP to a tenanted endpoint. Any existing federations configured with the global endpoint (for example, `urn:federation:MicrosoftOnline`) continue to work, but new federations stop working if your external IdP is expecting a global issuer URL in the SAML request sent by Microsoft Entra ID. |`https://login.microsoftonline.com//`
Replace `` with the tenant ID of the Microsoft Entra tenant you're setting up federation with. |\n |Issuer |The issuer URI of the partner's IdP, for example `http://www.example.com/exk10l6w90DHM0yi...` |The issuer URI of the partner's IdP, for example `http://www.example.com/exk10l6w90DHM0yi...` |\n " }, { "sha": "7704032790748516d5eae6bb216532fdcc9ab60a", "filename": "docs/identity-platform/tutorial-native-authentication-single-page-app-react-sign-in.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 2, "deletions": 2, "changes": 4, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/caa8b60d3aff0c2587dcab359041a7e045514f8b/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Ftutorial-native-authentication-single-page-app-react-sign-in.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/caa8b60d3aff0c2587dcab359041a7e045514f8b/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Ftutorial-native-authentication-single-page-app-react-sign-in.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity-platform%2Ftutorial-native-authentication-single-page-app-react-sign-in.md?ref=caa8b60d3aff0c2587dcab359041a7e045514f8b", "patch": "@@ -144,7 +144,7 @@ To do so, create a file called *src/client/SignInService.ts*, then add the follo\n };\n ```\n \n-The `challenge_type` property shows the authentication methods that the client app supports. This app signs is using email with password, so the challenge type value is *password oob redirect*. release of 2.5.76.0)|\n-|[2.5.76.0](#25760)||\n+|[2.5.76.0](#25760)|01 September 2026 (12 months after release of 2.5.79.0)|\n+|[2.5.79.0](#25790)||\n \n **All other versions are not supported**\n \n@@ -91,11 +92,31 @@ If you want all the latest features and updates, check this page and install wha\n \n To read more about autoupgrade, see [Microsoft Entra Connect: Automatic upgrade](how-to-connect-install-automatic-upgrade.md).\n \n+## 2.5.79.0\n+\n+### Release status\n+\n+09/01/2025: Released for download via the Microsoft Entra admin center. Existing installations will be auto-upgraded to this build starting September 4, 2025 and will be done in multiple phases. \n+\n+\n+### Added Features \n+\n+- Improved the setup process for Application-Based Authentication to handle TPM-backed certificates (certificates protected by a Trusted Platform Module, see [What is a TPM?](/windows/security/information-protection/tpm/trusted-platform-module-overview)). The system now tests a certificate’s signing capability upfront and automatically falls back to software-based certificates if TPM signature fails. \n+- Implemented automatic removal of certificates if an Application-Based Authentication configuration fails after a certificate is created. This prevents unused certificates from lingering on the server in failure scenarios, improving security by avoiding accumulation of orphaned certificates. \n+\n+### Bug fixes\n+\n+- Resolved an issue on FIPS-enabled servers that was causing setup failures. Application-Based Authentication now works correctly on servers with FIPS mode enabled by using FIPS-compliant cryptographic algorithms. \n+ > [!TIP]\n+ > FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standards) mode is a Windows security setting that enforces the use of cryptographic algorithms for sensitive data. When FIPS mode is enabled, only FIPS-compliant algorithms can be used, which is why this fix ensures compatibility for environments requiring strict security standards.\n+- Fixed an issue where certificate auto-rotation was incorrectly reported as active when the scheduler was suspended. The auto-rotation logic now checks the scheduler’s state before indicating status, ensuring the *View or export current configuration wizard* accurately reflects whether auto-rotation is enabled. \n+- Removed an inappropriate admin audit event that was being logged for automatic certificate operations. These background certificate actions no longer generate administrative audit log entries, resulting in a cleaner audit trail (only actual administrator-initiated changes will appear in the Entra Connect Sync audit logs). \n+\n ## 2.5.76.0\n \n ### Release status\n \n-07/31/2025: Released for download via the Microsoft Entra admin center. Existing installations will be auto-upgrades to this build starting August 14th, 2025, and will be done in multiple phases. \n+07/31/2025: Released for download via the Microsoft Entra admin center. Existing installations will be auto-upgraded to this build starting August 14th, 2025, and will be done in multiple phases. \n \n \n ### Added Features " } ]. Please summarize it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown."}
ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the changes in the provided commit files:

This commit updates documentation for Microsoft Entra ID. Firstly, it clarifies the `AssertionConsumerService` value for external tenants in the direct federation documentation, suggesting the addition of a specific callback/ACS URL if required by the external Identity Provider. Secondly, it corrects a minor typo in a React tutorial regarding the `challenge_type` property. Finally, it updates the Microsoft Entra Connect version history, adding details for version 2.5.79.0, including new features related to Application-Based Authentication and bug fixes for FIPS compliance and certificate auto-rotation reporting.
